citation.article-title: Novel members of the family Flavobacteriaceae from Antarctic maritime habitats including Subsaximicrobium wynnwilliamsii gen. nov., sp. nov., Subsaximicrobium saxinquilinus sp. nov., Subsaxibacter broadyi gen. nov., sp. nov., Lacinutrix copepodicola gen. nov., sp. nov., and novel species of the genera Bizionia, Gelidibacter and Gillisia
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Subsaximicrobium (Sub.sa.xi.mi.cro′.bi.um. L. pref. sub below; L. neut. n. saxum stone; N.L. neut. n. microbium microbe; N.L. neut. n. Subsaximicrobium microbe living below stone).
Gram-negative, rod-shaped cells, approximately 0·3–0·5 μm in width and 1–6 μm in length.
Older cultures contain many spherical cells (diameter 1–3 μm).
Exhibit gliding motility when grown on dilute agar media.
Cell mass is either yellow or orange.
Do not form resting cells or spores.
Major fatty acids include i15 : 1ω10c, a15 : 1ω10c, i15 : 0, a15 : 0, 16 : 1ω7c, 3-OH a15 : 0 and 3-OH i16 : 0.
A member of the family Flavobacteriaceae, class Flavobacteria, phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’.
The type species is Subsaximicrobium wynnwilliamsii.
